3. SUGARS AND SYRUPS

In what quantity did you buy white sugar? 10 lbs.

What was the price for a ten pound sack of white sugar? 50¢

What brand of golden corn syrup did you use? about 5 lbs.

What size of tin of syrup did you usually buy? Black Mallee.

At what price?

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days? Canned.

Butter? Eggs?

What was the price of butter? Of eggs?

Did you pack eggs for winter? How?

Did you make butter? Yes. Butter cheese? Yes.

What kind of cheese? Fresh from pasture cows.

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? Pork bacon monthly.

How did you get fresh meat? Short-ribs.

How often did you get fresh meat? Not very often.

How did you preserve meat? Drying it, brine, tender parts.

Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? No.

If so what year was it organized?

Did you use game? Plenty. What kinds? Pheasants, ducks, quail, woodcock.

For how long? While in season.

What part did fish play in the family diet? Not a great part.

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? Most canned, sometimes fresh.

Kinds? Cod, salmon.
